clinical_study.brief_title: Spasticity and Treatment Satisfaction Among Stroke Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Perceived Spasticity and Treatment Satisfaction Among Stroke Survivors Over the Course of a Complete Treatment Cycle With Botulinum Neurotoxin A (BoNT-A): an Ethnographic Study.

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate, through ethnography, changes in symptom burden and disability and their effects/interference on patient functioning, ability to perform activities of daily living (ADL) and quality of life (QoL) throughout the duration of one BoNT-A treatment cycle.

primary_outcome.measure: Degree of functional limitations in daily life activities
primary_outcome.time_frame: monthly for 12 Weeks, or until end of injection cycle whichever occurs first
primary_outcome.description: Degree of functional limitations in daily life activities (i.e. physical functioning) associated with post-stroke spasticity as assessed by using WHODAS parameters, and identification of their characteristics and changes over time

primary_outcome.measure: Health status in subjects with post-stroke spasticity
primary_outcome.time_frame: weekly for 12 Weeks, or until end of injection cycle whichever occurs first
primary_outcome.description: Health status in subjects with post-stroke spasticity as assessed by using EQ-5D-5L parameters, and identification of their characteristics and changes over time

Severity of Pain as per EQ-5D-5L and a sliding scale. This is a descriptive scale that covers 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activities,pain/discomfort and anxiety/depression. the scale consist of 5 levels, where level one corresponds to "no problems" and level 5 corresponds to "extreme problem".

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Opening interview and ending qualitative interviews, ethnography data which will be provided at discretion of patient/caregiver for 12 weeks or duration of treatment, whichever occurs first, may also support these qualitative analyses
secondary_outcome.description: Themes/domains related to the everyday life experiences of subjects with post-stroke spasticity (e.g. burden disease/treatment) through qualitative analysis of in-depth open-ended interviews

secondary_outcome.time_frame: weekly for 12 weeks or until end of injection cycle whichever occurs first. Opening and closing interview will also explore this
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects Report of Satisfaction with Treatment and their perception/desire of more tailored treatment options

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of feedback between caregivers and stroke survivors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: opening ( before week 1) and ending ( 2 weeks after end of injection cycle) qualitative interviews
secondary_outcome.description: Agreement between the themes elicited from semi-structured interviews between caregivers and subjects

study_pop.textblock: 40 Adults subjects (male or female) suffering from post-stroke spasticity (the US, UK, France, and Italy), who are treated with BoNT-A in the course of routine clinical practice for focal spasticity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnostic of post-stroke spasticity more than three months prior to inclusion
- At least 6 months on treatment (or two treatment cycles) with BoNT-A injections for spasticity according to the decision of the physician
- Previous BoNT-A injection cycles did not last for more than 16 weeks
- Ambulatory (use of walking aids is acceptable)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neurological disorder other than stroke
- Spasticity-specific treatment changes within 3 months prior to inclusion
- Patients who had undergone neurolysis or surgery to the affected limb within 6 months
- Concurrent participation in a clinical trial for the treatment of spasticity
